column1: Here you can specify which PostNL product options you have a contract for. Also you can specify the PostNL product options that will be used by the extension. You can always override the 'default option' settings by manually creating shipments. Please note that if you select a product option which is not covered by your PostNL contract it will result in an error.
column2: Here you can specify which PostNL product options you have a contract for. Also you can specify the PostNL product options that will be used by the extension. You can always override the 'default option' settings by manually creating shipments. Please note that if you select a product option which is not covered by your PostNL contract it will result in an error.

column1: Before you proceed to use this extension it is very important that you have properly configured certain elements of your Magento webshop.
column2: Before you proceed to use this extension it is very important that you have properly configured certain elements of your Magento webshop.

column1: You should make sure that each product you intend to ship using PostNL has a correct value for it's weight attribute. You can select a unit of measurement for this attribute in the 'Confirming & Label Settings' tab below. If you do not do this, PostNL may charge you extra when a parcel turns out to weigh significantly more than expected or they may even refuse your shipment.
column2: You should make sure that each product you intend to ship using PostNL has a correct value for it's weight attribute. You can select a unit of measurement for this attribute in the 'Confirming & Label Settings' tab below. If you do not do this, PostNL may charge you extra when a parcel turns out to weigh significantly more than expected or they may even refuse your shipment.

column1: Make sure the PostNL shipping method is configured under system > config > shipping methods > PostNL. Only shipments made using this shipping method will be able to use PostNL's services. You may choose to charge either a flat rate or a table rate-based shipping fee. In the case of the latter, the table rates you have added under the Table Rate shipping method will be used. More info on how to setup the Table Rate shipping method can be found here.
column2: Make sure the PostNL shipping method is configured under system > config > shipping methods > PostNL. Only shipments made using this shipping method will be able to use PostNL's services. You may choose to charge either a flat rate or a table rate-based shipping fee. In the case of the latter, the table rates you have added under the Table Rate shipping method will be used. More info on how to setup the Table Rate shipping method can be found here.

column1: You should properly configure your checkout process. PostNL needs to be able to retrieve a properly formatted address from the checkout process in order to guarantee the order is delivered at the correct address. In order to do so, you need to enable the appropriate number of street lines in your checkout flow and make sure these have correct labels and validation settings. More info on how to do this, can be found here.
column2: You should properly configure your checkout process. PostNL needs to be able to retrieve a properly formatted address from the checkout process in order to guarantee the order is delivered at the correct address. In order to do so, you need to enable the appropriate number of street lines in your checkout flow and make sure these have correct labels and validation settings. More info on how to do this, can be found here.

column1: Open the 'General Settings' tab and enter your email address.
column2: Open the 'General Settings' tab and enter your email address.

column1: Press the 'Activate the extension' button. You will now recieve an email at the address you specified containing 2 secure keys.
column2: Press the 'Activate the extension' button. You will now recieve an email at the address you specified containing 2 secure keys.

column1: Copy the keys and enter them in the 'Unique-' and 'Private key' fields that are now available.
column2: Copy the keys and enter them in the 'Unique-' and 'Private key' fields that are now available.

column1: Set the 'Active' field to 'Yes' and save the configuration. Your extension is now registered.
column2: Set the 'Active' field to 'Yes' and save the configuration. Your extension is now registered.

column1: Make sure you have your PostNL account info with you. You will need the following info: username & password, customer number, customer code, and BLS code. You need to enter these in the 'Account Settings' tab.
column2: Make sure you have your PostNL account info with you. You will need the following info: username & password, customer number, customer code, and BLS code. You need to enter these in the 'Account Settings' tab.

column1: First enter your username and password. Depending on the status of your account, you may either enter the 'test' or 'live' version of these fields. Please note: if you do not enter the 'live' fields, you will only be able to create test shipments.
column2: First enter your username and password. Depending on the status of your account, you may either enter the 'test' or 'live' version of these fields. Please note: if you do not enter the 'live' fields, you will only be able to create test shipments.

column1: Next enter your customer number, customer code and BLS code. If you are unsure about which information to enter here, please contact PostNL.
column2: Next enter your customer number, customer code and BLS code. If you are unsure about which information to enter here, please contact PostNL.

column1: Enter a sender and return address
column2: Enter a sender and return address

column1: You have to enter the address to which PostNL may return shipments that could not be delivered. The sender address is mandatory. You may also enter a separate, optional return address.
column2: You have to enter the address to which PostNL may return shipments that could not be delivered. The sender address is mandatory. You may also enter a separate, optional return address.

column1: Go to the 'Sender Address' tab and enter your address. If you enter a company name, it will be printed on the shipping label. Otherwise, your name will be printed.
column2: Go to the 'Sender Address' tab and enter your address. If you enter a company name, it will be printed on the shipping label. Otherwise, your name will be printed.

column1: You may now choose to enter a separate return address. If you choose to do so, this address will be printed on the shipping labels, rather than your sender address.
column2: You may now choose to enter a separate return address. If you choose to do so, this address will be printed on the shipping labels, rather than your sender address.

column1: In order to enter a separare return address, go to the 'Return Address' tab and switch the 'Use the sender address as the return adress' settng to 'no'. New fields will now appear for you to enter your return address.
column2: In order to enter a separare return address, go to the 'Return Address' tab and switch the 'Use the sender address as the return adress' settng to 'no'. New fields will now appear for you to enter your return address.

column1: Configure your address settings, your confirming & label printing preferences and your preferred product options
column2: Configure your address settings, your confirming & label printing preferences and your preferred product options

column1: Go to the 'Address Settings' tab and configure this section based on which fields you use in your checkout process. If this does not precisely match your checkout process, orders may not be shipped to the correct address.
column2: Go to the 'Address Settings' tab and configure this section based on which fields you use in your checkout process. If this does not precisely match your checkout process, orders may not be shipped to the correct address.

column1: Go to the 'Confirming & Label Printing Settings' tab and change your preferences. You may want to tweak these and then test them repeatedly before deciding on a final configuration.
column2: Go to the 'Confirming & Label Printing Settings' tab and change your preferences. You may want to tweak these and then test them repeatedly before deciding on a final configuration.

column1: Go to the 'Product Options' tab and select your supported and preferred product options. If you have questions regarding each product option and which would be most suitable to you, please contact PostNL.
column2: Go to the 'Product Options' tab and select your supported and preferred product options. If you have questions regarding each product option and which would be most suitable to you, please contact PostNL.

column1: If you wish to send orders to outside the EU, you need to configure your GlobalPack settings.
column2: If you wish to send orders to outside the EU, you need to configure your GlobalPack settings.

column1: Go to the 'Account Settings' tab and fill in the 'Global Barcode Type' and 'Global Barcode Range' fields.
column2: Go to the 'Account Settings' tab and fill in the 'Global Barcode Type' and 'Global Barcode Range' fields.

column1: Go to the 'GlobalPack Settings' tab and specify your preferences. Be aware, that if you do not configure these settings correctly, international shipments may be refused by either PostNL or the customs office.
column2: Go to the 'GlobalPack Settings' tab and specify your preferences. Be aware, that if you do not configure these settings correctly, international shipments may be refused by either PostNL or the customs office.

column1: If you wish to use PostNL Checkout in your webshop, you need to configure your PostNl Checkout settings.
column2: If you wish to use PostNL Checkout in your webshop, you need to configure your PostNl Checkout settings.

column1: Go to the 'Account Settings' tab and fill in the 'Webshop ID' and 'Public Webshop ID' fields.
column2: Go to the 'Account Settings' tab and fill in the 'Webshop ID' and 'Public Webshop ID' fields.

column1: Go to the 'PostNL Checkout' tab and specify your preferences.
column2: Go to the 'PostNL Checkout' tab and specify your preferences.

column1: Go to the 'PostNL Checkout Paymen Settings' tab and specify which payment methods PostNL Checkout supports. Here you must also link the PostNL Checkout payment methods to the payment methods you use in Magento. If you do not configure this properly, customers may be forced to pay with a different payment method than the one they selected.
column2: Go to the 'PostNL Checkout Paymen Settings' tab and specify which payment methods PostNL Checkout supports. Here you must also link the PostNL Checkout payment methods to the payment methods you use in Magento. If you do not configure this properly, customers may be forced to pay with a different payment method than the one they selected.

column2: If you wish to use this extension on an unsupported Magento version or edition, or in combination with an unsupported 3rd party extension, we cannot guarantee the PostNL extension will function as expected. For questions please contact the Total Internet Group servicedesk.

column1:
Here you can enable or disable PostNL Checkout as well as completely customize all of it's facets.

By using PostNL Checkout you can offer your customers the option to easily choose their desired delivery date. They will be able to choose when and where they want their order delivered. They may choose to have the order delivered to their home (on a specific day at a specific time) or to have it delivered to their nearest post office.

PostNL Checkout is a free service, however you do need to register yourself with PostNL. You will then receive all necessary information in order to configure this feature.
column2:
Here you can enable or disable PostNL Checkout as well as completely customize all of it's facets.

By using PostNL Checkout you can offer your customers the option to easily choose their desired delivery date. They will be able to choose when and where they want their order delivered. They may choose to have the order delivered to their home (on a specific day at a specific time) or to have it delivered to their nearest post office.

PostNL Checkout is a free service, however you do need to register yourself with PostNL. You will then receive all necessary information in order to configure this feature.

column1: If you do not use split street lines and you wish to ship to outside the EU, there is a strong possibility that PostNL will be unable to properly parse the address. This may result in the shipment being refused or it may even lead to the shipment being delivered at the wrong address!

column1: The HS tariff value is a number used to identify the type of product that is shipped. In general this is only required for larger export volumes. If you disable this setting the value '000000' will be used. Please contact PostNL for more information.
column2: The HS tariff value is a number used to identify the type of product that is shipped. In general this is only required for larger export volumes. If you disable this setting the value '000000' will be used. Please contact PostNL for more information.

column1: Customers can select a specific date and time when they want their shipment delivered when they use PostNL Checkout. If they are attempting to order an item that is not in stock it's possible that you won't be able to guarantee that the item will be delieverd on the chosen date and time. If this setting is disabled customers will not be able to use PostNL Checkout if they are attempting to order an item that is not in stock, thereby preventing this situation.
column2: Customers can select a specific date and time when they want their shipment delivered when they use PostNL Checkout. If they are attempting to order an item that is not in stock it's possible that you won't be able to guarantee that the item will be delieverd on the chosen date and time. If this setting is disabled customers will not be able to use PostNL Checkout if they are attempting to order an item that is not in stock, thereby preventing this situation.

column1: You can enter your live username and password in the 'Account Settings' tab. Don't forget to also update your customer number, customer code and BLS (location) code. You can then set the extension to live mode in the 'Confirming and Label Printing Settings' tab. If you use PostNL Checkout you also need to set PostNL Checkout to live mode in the 'PostNL Checkout Settings' tab.
column2: You can enter your live username and password in the 'Account Settings' tab. Don't forget to also update your customer number, customer code and BLS (location) code. You can then set the extension to live mode in the 'Confirming and Label Printing Settings' tab. If you use PostNL Checkout you also need to set PostNL Checkout to live mode in the 'PostNL Checkout Settings' tab.

column1: You may test the extension, however you cannot send any shipments in this mode. Any shipments that you confirm or whose labels you print while in this mode will be registered as test shipments and may not be physically shipped. If you attempt to do so, you may incur fines from PostNL. To use the extension in live mode you first need to enter your PostNL account credentials and set the extension to live mode. You can then send shipments using the PostNL extension.
column2: You may test the extension, however you cannot send any shipments in this mode. Any shipments that you confirm or whose labels you print while in this mode will be registered as test shipments and may not be physically shipped. If you attempt to do so, you may incur fines from PostNL. To use the extension in live mode you first need to enter your PostNL account credentials and set the extension to live mode. You can then send shipments using the PostNL extension.

column1: You can enter your live username and password in the 'Account Settings' tab of the PostNL extension configuration. Don't forget to also update your customer number, customer code and BLS (location) code. You can then set the extension to live mode in the 'Confirming and Label Printing Settings' tab. If you use PostNL Checkout you also need to set PostNL Checkout to live mode in the 'PostNL Checkout Settings' tab.
column2: You can enter your live username and password in the 'Account Settings' tab of the PostNL extension configuration. Don't forget to also update your customer number, customer code and BLS (location) code. You can then set the extension to live mode in the 'Confirming and Label Printing Settings' tab. If you use PostNL Checkout you also need to set PostNL Checkout to live mode in the 'PostNL Checkout Settings' tab.

column1: Are you sure that you wish to reset the confirmation status of this shipment? You will need to confirm this shipment with PostNL again before you can send it. This action will remove all barcodes and labels associated with this shipment. You can not undo this action.
